citation.article-title: Heliorestis daurensis, gen. nov. sp. nov., An alkaliphilic rod-to-coiled-shaped phototrophic heliobacterium from a siberian soda lake

p.s: Heliorestis ( He.li.o.res'tis, G.n. helios, the sun; L.fem.n. restis, a rope; Heliorestis, the solar rope)
Cells forming coils or bent filaments of variable length up to 20 Î¼m.
Stain gram-negative but lack an outer membrane.
Contains bacteriochlorophyll g and neurosporene-like carotenoid pigments, but lacks intracytoplasmic membranes or chlorosomes.
Phylogenetic position within the heliobacterial clade of the low- G+C, gram-positive bacteria but basal to the genera Heliobacterium, Heliobacillus, and Heliophilum.
Habitat: alkaline soils or soda lakes.
